title: Saadi Shirazi
summary: Saadi Shīrāzī[2] (Persian: ابومحمّد مصلح‌الدین بن عبدالله شیرازی‎), better known by his pen name Saadi (/ˈsɑːdi/;[3] Persian: سعدی‎, romanized: Saʿdī, IPA: [sæʔˈdiː]), also known as Sadi of Shiraz (سعدی شیرازی, Saʿdī Shīrāzī; born 1210; died 1291 or 1292), was a major Persian poet and prose writer[4][5] of the medieval period. He is recognized for the quality of his writings and for the depth of his social and moral thoughts.
